ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: French 876 is a very interesting class on 18th century French literature. I would recommend it.
Unfortunately, I don't think the class is going to offered again (at least not by Professor Kavanagh), but I would, hypothetically, recommend it.

"Libertins et philosophes" was incredibly useful to me, as someone who had little to no previous knowledge of the 18th century. As I said before, I appreciated the balance between literature and philosophical texts, and the authors we read were wide-ranging, although surely there would have been room for some female voices, especially given how important the theme of gender relations was in much of what we read.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: I don't know how much the course will contribute to my own writing I am primarily interested in the twentieth century but the course gave me a good grounding, I think, in a century and subject I hadn't done much work on. In this sense it was highly productive.
The course deepened my knowledge of the discipline in focusing on a specific aspect of eighteenth-century France but also covering a number of canonical works. A useful foundation.
